page.title: 19Transport
page.content: Communications in the Abergavenny area are quite good.Main roads lead to Hereford,Brecon,Pontypool,Raglan and the Heads of the Valleys road links us to the West.We conducted a traffic count and found that on Monday at 2.30pm Brecon Rd was the busiest.The carparks in the town are free.The post office carpark is the largest.The market area is not used on Tuesdays and Fridays when the stalls are set up.The railway line goes to Hereford to the north and through to Cardiff in the south.It is possible to reach London, Birmingham,Swansea by changing trains. There are only 8 trains a day.Buses run more often but are expensive.You can reach Brecon,Cwmbran,Hereford and more distant places. Market day buses serve the villages and National Express picks up passengers.Most families have access to a car.
